intro: Psychotria ammericola, commonly known as the American Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. It often grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria ammericola is also known for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain species of butterflies.
